mdRecord.dcterms:title: The Creamery, exterior
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: This structure measures 30x45 feet, and it was built between 1903 and 1905 under the direction of a non-Shaker carpenter, S. H. Mead. He constructed the building with two stories, an attic, a full cellar, and a gable roof of slate. The sisters who were engaged in dairying lived upstairs in the Creamery. -- http://www.shakers.org/the_creamery.html [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Architecture and City Planning

mdRecord.dcterms:spatial: 288 Shaker Road, Canterbury, Merrimack, New Hampshire, United States
